item.title: Report E-2025060133
item.description:
Report E-2025060133

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-03
  • City: ALBUQUERQUE
  • State: NM
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 3, 2025, one (1) 55-gallon drum of sodium hydroxide solution fell over in transit due to improper securement and released approximately four (4) ounces of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Restoration (ER) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized absorbent pads and cleaning agents to wipe down the drum and impacted floor. ER personnel then replaced the bung on the drum and staged it onsite for further processing. All impacted materials were containerized in one (1) 5-gallon pail for future disposal.

item.title: Report X-2025052118
item.description:
Report X-2025052118

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-27
  • City: ALBUQUERQUE
  • State: NM
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Amanda Linebarger, 120/ABQ operations supervisor, reported a 1 lb spill of UN1485, Potassium Chlorate, 5.1, II in the nose of trailer 553264 and a small amount at dock door 70. Amanda advised this spill was discovered while unloading and appeared to have happened in transit. 120/ABQ contained the sp ill and Cura has been contacted to send a crew to remediate the spill. Safety asked Cura to have the crew confirm the cause of the spill and the amount spilled. ER personnel unstacked the pallet of potassium chlorate and discovered five (5) damaged 55-pound bags. Crews utilized a HEPA vac to collect all spilled material. All remaining freight was collecting into a cubic yard box for further handling by ABF. Crews collected five (5) damaged 55-pound bags of potassium chlorate into one (1) 55-gallon drum. All impacted PPE and debris were collected and containerized into one (1) 30-gallon drum. A ll collected waste was staged onsite for future transport and disposal by CES. Crews received site approval from Amanda Leinburg, secured the scene, and demobilized.

item.title: Report E-2025060302
item.description:
Report E-2025060302

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-17
  • City: ALBUQUERQUE
  • State: NM
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: SOLE TRANSPORT, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 36150
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Solar Driver was heading to a local gas station for fuel delivery. He was on Interstate 25 Southbound in Albuquerque, NM when he struck a piece of road debris. This road debris punctured a hole in the saddle bag tank of his Tractor. Driver pulled over to check the damage near I-25 exit 221. At this time he sees the damage to the fuel tank and fuel leaking from it. He called 911 for help FD showed up in roughly 5 minutes and was able to patch the hole in the tank. Roughly 50 gallons was released onto the concrete and dirt where the unit was stopped. Once Solar Dispatch was contacted we dispatched Environmental Restoration to the scene for clean up. Once on site they determined the Fire Dept had cleaned the impacted concrete but the spill had migrated to the soil and roughly 30 feet down the hill that is in the area. The clean up crew deployed granular absorbents to soil to soak up any fuel and protect against any further migration. They also took soil samples at the site and determined the product seeped down 6 inches into the soil. Excavation of the area has been scheduled but Environmental Restoration and is going to take place on Thursday June 19th.

item.title: Report E-2025060181
item.description:
Report E-2025060181

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-01
  • City: HOBBS
  • State: NM
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: GROENDYKE TRANSPORT INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 3965
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Drivers performing a pump out of gas/diesel mixture at a gas station when the trailer was overfilled causing a spill from the dome lid. Roughly 52 gallons were spilled onto the parking lot. Trainer was on the ground pumping product and trainee was on top of the trailer monitoring the level inside of the tanker. Trainee was asked by the trainer multiple times if the product was getting close to the top and used poor judgement causing the spill.
